definition: psychological effect/subjective experience affected more by one's expectations than by objective reality/figment of the imagination
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: The psychological effects often exacerbate health problems that the physiological stress response has already caused.
sentences.chinese: 心理作用通常加劇了生理負擔早已引發的健康問題。

sentences.english: You get a gown, but its coverage is more psychological than physical!
sentences.chinese: 你會有一件袍子，但是它更多隻能起到心理作用。

sentences.english: The researchers wanted to look at the role of psychological issues.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員希望知道心理作用是否影響了測驗成績。

sentences.english: It's true; being bothered by floaters is entirely psychological.
sentences.chinese: 飛蚊症的惹人之處全是心理作用。

sentences.english: Maybe because of their psychological actions.
sentences.chinese: 或許是他們心理作用吧。

sentences.english: The study highlights the psychological importance of personal control of one's destiny in providing security.
sentences.chinese: 研究強調個人掌控自我命運時，心理作用的重要性。

sentences.english: Finally, don't underestimate the psychological impact of color.
sentences.chinese: 最後，不要低估了色彩帶來的心理作用。

sentences.english: That's because there are automatic psychological processes supporting superstition.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲無意識心理作用在支撐着迷信。

sentences.english: That line of thinking is all just part of your conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的思考只不過是你的心理作用而已。

definition: varying from person to person (idiom); different for each individual
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
every medicine has its side effect
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
